stem: A patient has an absent patellar reflex after a pelvic mass compresses a nerve beneath the inguinal ligament. Which nerve is most likely affected?
rationale_correct: The patellar reflex (L2–L4) tests the femoral nerve via quadriceps contraction.

rationale_distractors.A: Obturator primarily adducts the thigh; not the knee jerk reflex.
rationale_distractors.B: Sciatic does not mediate the patellar reflex.
rationale_distractors.D: Common peroneal supplies lateral/anterior leg; not quadriceps.
rationale_distractors.E: Tibial supplies posterior thigh/leg; not quadriceps.

evidence.citation: Heck C. Lower Limb Overview Handout — Thigh compartments (L2–L4 femoral). Jun 16, 2025.
